name: Acarbose
description: Alpha-glucosidase inhibitor that slows carbohydrate digestion, reducing postprandial glucose spikes. One of only four drugs to extend lifespan in the NIA Interventions Testing Program (ITP) in mice. Particularly effective in males. Prescription required.

dosage.notes: Start at 25mg to minimize GI side effects. Take with first bite of food. Prescription drug. NIA ITP positive result.

keyFindings: Extended lifespan in male mice by ~22% in NIA ITP (one of only 4 positive drugs)
Reduced cardiovascular events by 49% in STOP-NIDDM trial
